flawed_nl_solution:
His new computer uses 800*0.5=<<800*0.5=400>>400 watts more than his old computer
So it users 800+400=<<800+400=1200>>1200 watts
That is 1200/1000=<<1200/1000=1.2>>1.2 kw
Electricity cost 12*0.25=<<12*0.25=3>>3 cents more than it used to
So it now cost 12+3=<<12+3=15>>15 cents per kwh
He used 1.2*50=<<1.2*50=60>>60 kwh
So he paid 15*60=<<15*60=9000>>9000 cents per kwh
So he paid 9000/100=$<<9000/100=90>>90
#### 90

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 900, not 9000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
